doc.previous: Conditional probability is the probability of some event A, given the occurrence of some other event B. Conditional probability is written , and is read "the probability of A, given B". It is defined by[23]
doc.after: If then is formally undefined by this expression. However, it is possible to define a conditional probability for some zero-probability events using a Ï-algebra of such events (such as those arising from a continuous random variable).[citation needed]
